newsitem.title: DENMARK: Denmark sees 15.3 bln crown 1996 public deficit.
newsitem.headline: Denmark sees 15.3 bln crown 1996 public deficit.

text.p: Denmark's economy ministry said on Thursday it expected a public sector deficit of 15.3 billion crowns at the end of 1996.

The forecast, published in the latest ministry economic review compared with a May 1996 prediction of a 12.0 billion crown shortfall, which was equivalent of 1.2 percent of GDP (gross domestic product), and down on the actual 1995 deficit of 16.2 billion crowns.
The survey saw a 1997 deficit of 5.8 billion crowns, against May's forecast of 9.1 billion crowns, or 0.9 percent of GDP.
